title: PSG aim to hijack Real Madrid's move for Christian Eriksen next summer
text:
Paris St Germain are set to hijack Real Madrid’s move for Christian Eriksen next summer.

The Tottenham midfield player has turned down the chance of a new contract at White Hart Lane.

The club would like to sell the 27-year-old Denmark international in the January window to recoup some cash.

Christian Eriksen's contract is up at the end of the season, and is expected to join Real Madrid

However, PSG have now become contenders for his signature as they look to hijack the deal

But Eriksen knows he can secure a more lucrative deal next June when he is on a free transfer and is likely to hold out for a move in the summer.

He is able to sign a pre-contract in January for a club outside England.

That is when PSG plan to move in. Real have Eriksen on their wanted list along with Paul Pogba of Manchester United.

But the French champions also want Eriksen.

Spurs want to sell Eriksen in January, but he will get a better deal if he holds out til the summer

Currently they are overloaded in midfield but want to have a clear out at the end of the season.

Two of the prime candidates to be put on the market are Leandro Paredes, a £22.5 million signing from Zenit St Petersburg and German World Cup winner Julian Draxler.

They plan to sell the pair and bring in Eriksen.
description: Paris St Germain are set to hijack Real Madrid's move for Christian Eriksen next summer. The Tottenham midfield player has turned down the chance of a new contract at White Hart Lane.
authors: Steve Stammers For The Mail On Sunday
